page.title: 13LAND RECLAMATION
page.content: The area of Rod Moor that was used by the clay industry is marked with shallow pits,which present no eye-sore, but the north west corner has a large disused quarry which is a region of depressions surrounded by banks of spoil,mainly shale, upon which no vegetation grows. It is a wet,desolate place,and only within a few years been abandoned. The father of the present owner of Rod Moor planted a coniferous wood along the edge of the moor above Loadbrook and also around Platts. The southernmost border of the area is the edge of the Yorkshire Water Authority plantation{Wyming Brook}, above Rivelin Reservoir.
